intro: Spartium persicum, commonly known as Persian spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features upright, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered with fine hairs. Spartium persicum is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
